name: claymation
prompt: Animate the uploaded person as an Aardman clay stop-motion character (Wallace & Gromit). Identity lock (face, hair, outfit). Design: rounded head/cheeks, big sausage nose, dot/oval eyes, wide hinged grin with square block teeth; matte Plasticine skin with subtle fingerprints and seam joins; brows/hair as rolled clay; chunky knit/tweed clothes. Lighting: soft warm studio, gentle shadows, no glossy speculars. BG: neutral warm-cream or cozy workshop corner, uncluttered. Stop-motion rules: animate on twos (~12-fps look), stepped poses (no spline), no motion blur; slight camera gate jitter; tiny pose pops; limited secondary (cloth/hair behave like clay), small dent "boil," brief pose holds; slow dolly/tilt only; keep the model consistent frame-to-frame. Dance/action: upbeat, goofy clay jig to a 120–140 BPM beat—heel-toe shuffle, knee bounces, elbows tucked, open-palm waves, head tilts, simple turns/hops; varied, non-repeating phrases with clear, readable silhouettes. Framing: entire body and head always in frame; camera mostly locked with subtle push-ins or lateral slides. Negative: glossy CG polish, photoreal pores, neon palette, heavy motion blur, high-fps smoothness, modern non-Aardman props.

name: french
prompt: Animate the uploaded person in a hand-drawn French caricature style: wiry scratchy inks, flat fills, watercolor/ink-wash shadows, visible paper grain; no 3D shading or speculars. Identity lock: preserve likeness (hair color/style, skin tone, key accessories) while caricaturing features: elongated head, prominent long nose, droopy eyelids with tiny pupils, slightly jutting chin; hunched shoulder line; skinny limbs with big hands/feet. Palette: muted sepias/olives/mustards/rusts with dusty teal accents; aged poster look. Background: neutral warm paper backdrop with faint vignette; no props or scenery. Animation look: animate on twos (≈12-fps feel); light boiling lines; snappy holds; minimal smears; no motion blur; camera locked or very slow drift only. Action (dance): wry, quirky shuffle to a swing/musette or mid-tempo beat—shoulder sways, pigeon-toed steps, elbows out, lanky arm arcs, occasional bicycle-pedal pantomime; varied, non-repeating phrases; always keep a clear silhouette. Framing: entire body and head always in frame; centered staging. Grade: overcast, low contrast; slight vignette; subtle paper speckle. Negative cues: 3D/PBR, shiny highlights, photoreal pores, clean vector lines, perfect perspective, neon colors, heavy DOF blur, anime eye gloss, glossy CG clothing.

name: antiquepuppet
prompt: Animate the uploaded person as an antique marionette theatre puppet (Opera-dei-Pupi / old European stage). Identity lock: keep face/hair/outfit cues but translate to puppet form. Build & materials: carved wood / papier-mâché head and hands with gesso + brush-paint, tiny nicks, hairline cracks, aged varnish sheen; glassy painted eyes; narrow torso. Joints & strings: hinged shoulders/elbows/wrists, rigid jaw; visible taut strings from crown, shoulders and wrists (slight sway). Costume: faded brocade/velvet with lace ruff/cuffs, trims/medal; a little worn. Stage: wooden floorboards and a painted canvas backdrop (pastoral/architectural) with soft wrinkles; footlights + cool sidelight; warm sepia grade, mild vignette, light 16 mm grain. Stop-motion rules: animate on twos (~12-fps feel) with stepped holds (no spline), no motion blur; tiny gate-weave; limited joint range true to marionettes; gentle pendulum sway from the strings; small string tension bounces; keep model consistent frame-to-frame. Dance/action: courtly minuet/jig to a ~100–120 BPM beat—heel taps, side-steps, bow/curtsy, wrist flutters, hand flourishes; occasional jaw flap on downbeats; varied, non-repeating phrases with clear silhouettes. Camera & framing: proscenium/tripod view; medium full-body; slow, tiny dolly or pan only; entire body and head always in frame. Negative cues: smooth high-fps CG, silicone/latex look, glossy PBR plastic, neon palette, modern props/logos, heavy DOF blur, removing/hiding strings.

name: peanuts
prompt: Animate the uploaded person in a hand-drawn Peanuts newspaper-strip style. Identity lock: keep hair color/part, skin tone, outfit colors/patterns (translate to simple stripes/zigzags). Design: large round head, tiny body, tube limbs, big oval shoes; dot eyes, tiny U-shaped nose, 1–2 line mouth; hair as a few squiggle lines. Render: wobbly black ink lines with slight jitter; flat color fills only (no gradients); subtle cream paper grain. Background: plain pastel or a single horizon line; uncluttered. Animation look: limited 2D—animate on twos/fours (~12–8 fps feel), short holds, gentle line boil, no motion blur. Camera static or tiny pan; no zooms. Dance/action: cheerful side-to-side bounce with step-touches, claps, little hops, head bobs and arm swings; varied, non-repeating phrases; always keep a clear silhouette. Framing: mid-wide to full-body; head always in frame; keep staging centered. Negative cues: 3D/PBR look, gradients or cel-shading, glossy highlights, photoreal textures, vector-perfect lines, complex backgrounds, anime eye gloss.
